column5: hey guys, a buddy and i went out to a small lake we know yesterday in hopes of catching a few buckets... 8)  8)   i gave hime a trusty top water that i knew would be successful due to the conditions when we arrived.... about 2 mins after we started fishing the magic of the top water lure had begun....   here was a little guy to start him off    a few casts later and the size increases a little!!    and again    it was about time i was thnking  of putting on of those bad boys on...  but i didn't.... i wanted to try out some new baits i had purchased... which i never ended up catching any fish on.... if anyone has any pointers of successful techniques used to fish horney toads (zoom) let me know!!!  anyways there was about a 2 1/2 hour lull where nothin was caught....we had a little snooze on the boat and then i thought i would give it one last crack.... here are the results.....      each of us with our double header pic!!  and then i started to DOMINATE!!!!          it was a great feeling..... i found a system that was working, stuck with it and it paid off.....all fish were released to catch another day!!!!!!!!   hope you enjoyed the report!!!!!
Wow those Bass just kept getting bigger and bigger and bigger.Excellent report.MTP
That's awesome, looks like you've quite the honey hole there!
looks like a great day of fishing
Those are some sweet Bass!  Thanks for sharing!  Maureen
Wow, the incredible "increasing size" pond/ If you stayed out there til this morning your fish would probably be into the 20 lb range! lol  Great report, looks like you had a blast!
hahaha sure did!!!!  thanks for the comments guys!!
Great day out there, especially when you can get your buddy into the fish too.  I like the way they incrementally kept getting bigger.
Wow!  Great report and some really NICE bass you got there!  Congrats on a great day out there.
1 simple tip for the horny toad.  Keep throwing it.  It's one of the best baits on the market.  I don't leave home without em.    Charles
those look ike some awesome bass!  Great report!  Cheers!

well that's what i have heard about the horny toad, resulting in me buying about  6 packs in various colours.... i noticed when i am casting them out there however they tend to sink and sometimes turn over... is thos ok or should i be presenting them different???  i am rigging them weedless with a 5/0 wide gap hook or corkscrew hook...  thanks for the info....

I fish em on 65 lb braid with an Owner 6/0 EWG.  They will sink if you are not retrieving them but I've caught them while they are sinking as well.  They will turn over but it's not a big deal.  Often once it is chewed up, I'll flip it over and re-hook it to get a few more fish out of it.  Charles
alright that pretty much what i was doing... guess i'll just keep pluggin away until i get confident in the bait!!!!!
Nice job! You'd be surprised what kind of monster bass live in Ontarios smaller lakes.
i know i love fishing the smaller lakes rather than the bigger ones.... you dont have to worry about weather conditions nearly as much!!!!!!
Nice buckets you guys got into, nice work  Aaron
Sweet Georgia Brown son...those are some serious bass.
Some nice fish for sure!  Thanks for sharing. dk
great report those are some big buckets
hey .... when i have a day like that i gotta share it.... lets just hope there are many more to come!!!!!!
You caught more bass in one day than my wife and I did in an entire week ... last week.   Way to go with finding the right combination to trigger strikes.  Nicely done.
